results.authors: By Lu Wang and Isabelle Lee
results.headline: Big Reshuffle of $71 Billion ETF Looms as Nvidia Surpasses Apple
results.summary: One of the world’s most prominent technology ETFs looks poised for a big rebalancing that would ramp up exposure to Nvidia Corp. at the expense of Apple Inc. – spurring billions of dollars in trading volume in one fell swoop.

results.authors: By Charlotte Yang and Jeanny Yu
results.headline: Popular Arbitrage Trade Backfires as TSMC Frenzy Grows in US
results.summary: The long-favored arbitrage strategy of buying Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s Taipei shares while shorting its US listing is starting to become painful.

results.authors: By Enda Curran and Saleha Mohsin
results.headline: How the US Mopped Up a Third of Global Capital Flows Since Covid
results.summary: In the face of calls around the world to diversify out of the dollar in recent years, the US has nabbed almost one-third of all the investment that flowed across borders since Covid struck.

results.headline: Taiwan Envoy Says Island Deepening Ties With US to Deter China
results.summary: Taiwan is deepening economic integration with other democracies and working with partners including the US to deter China’s President Xi Jinping from ordering an invasion of the island, Taipei’s envoy to Washington said.

results.headline: AI Demand Helps Korean Chip Export Prices to Record Jump in May
results.summary: The price of South Korea’s semiconductor exports rose at a record pace in May, underscoring the strength of an AI rally powering the country’s economic momentum.

results.authors: By Christopher Condon and Charles Ayitey
results.headline: Yellen Says Big Chinese Banks Are Adhering to Russian Sanctions
results.summary: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said she was most concerned about smaller Chinese banks doing business with Russia, even as she didn’t rule out sanctioning a bigger lender if it engaged in “systematic violations” of sanctions against the Kremlin.

results.headline: What Is a Stock Split? All About Broadcom's (AVGO) 10-for-1 Split
results.summary: The practice — which isn't as popular as it once was — is the equivalent of swapping a $10 bill for 10 $1 bills.

results.headline: Broadcom’s AI-Fueled Forecast Triggers Biggest Rally Since 2020
results.summary: Broadcom Inc., a chip supplier for Apple Inc. and other big tech companies, rose as much as 16% in New York trading after delivering strong results and an upbeat forecast, lifted by robust demand for artificial intelligence products.

results.headline: Biden Must Rally a Reluctant G-7 Against the Russia-China Axis
results.summary: To bag a win in Italy, the US president should unite the G-7 to crack down on China’s support for Russia’s war machine.

results.authors: By Tania Chen and Rebecca Choong Wilkins
results.headline: US’s China Export Limits Hurt Both Nations, China Advisor Says
results.summary: US efforts to curb the export of key technologies to China are hurting both economies and may prove counterproductive, according to Jia Qingguo, a prominent academic and standing committee member of Beijing’s top political advisory body.
